lead_paragraph: STEPHEN GIRARD, in his last will and testament, decreed that no clergyman, of any denomination, should ever he admitted within the walls of his college. This dictum, although based on the notion of preventing sectarian polemics from con founding the ideas of the pupils, gave much offense to the religious world.
